description:
The three Kisugi sisters —Rui, Hitomi and Ai— during the day run a small cafe called "Cat's Eye". To discover the whereabouts of their father, the artist Michael Heintz, who has disappeared, Hitomi and her sisters rob art galleries as the smart and mysterious thief "Cat's Eye" in the hope that his works can give them clues about his vanishing. The crucial point is that Hitomi has a relationship with Toshi, a police inspector who has sworn to catch "Cat's Eye" —and of course he has no idea about Hitomi's double life.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Features a business that prepares and serves food and drinks to customers. Also encompasses cafes and bistros.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description: An Italian singer and actress. She sings for television and animation series, and has recorded numerous albums, selling nearly 7 million copies. In Italy, she is also known for singing the Italian version of the theme song of many anime, including One Piece, Doraemon, Attacker YOU! ("Mila e Shiro" in Italian), Sailor Moon and Captain Tsubasa ("Holly e Benji" in Italian).

__Real name:__ Eiko Kawashima

[Website](https://anri-music.com/s/anri/?ima=3544) l [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/intl-pt/artist/0xGtOrmB2hnrNRLG3vhpSo) l [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/anri1105/) l [Twitter](https://twitter.com/1105_anri)

Anri is a Japanese singer and songwriter. She has written much of her own music as well as singing songs written by others such as her debut release Oribia o Kikinagara, by Ozaki Amii. Her song Cat's Eye was used as the first opening theme for the eponymous 1983 anime series Cat's Eye and debuted as #1 on Countdown Japan. It was one of the first J-pop songs used as an anime theme song, and it was included in a recent Dance Dance Revolution game. Her popularly skyrocketed following her appearance at the Red and White New Year's Music Special at the end of that same year.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/杉野昭夫) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akio_Sugino)

A veteran animator with a career spanning over 50 years.

Noted for his work on shows like [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2402/), [Ace wo Nerae!](https://anilist.co/anime/311/), [Nobody's Boy: Remi](https://anilist.co/anime/2828/) and [Treasure Island](https://anilist.co/anime/2618/).
Founder and representative director of [The Answer Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/229/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/寺田憲史)

Terada's more notable works include writing the first three games of the Final Fantasy series. He also worked on Batman: Dark Tomorrow, created the concept for the Sega CD game Dark Wizard, and was the main script writer for the [Kimagure Orange Road](https://anilist.co/anime/1087/) series among other things.

[Official Website](http://www.hojo-tsukasa.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hojo_official)

He studied technical design at Kyushu Sangyo University, where he began to draw manga. Hojo is a mentor of Takehiko Inoue (creator of Slam Dunk) and a longtime friend of Tetsuo Hara (creator of Fist of the North Star). Designed the character Reina, who was introduced in the 2006 movie Hokuto no Ken: Raō Den - Jun'ai no Shō.

A veteran in his field, having worked as a sound director for over 40 years from late '60s onwards. Predominantly known for his involvement in the [Lupin III](https://anilist.co/anime/1412/) franchise, in which he acted as a sound director for all the series' entries from the [second TV series](https://anilist.co/anime/1425/) onwards up until his retirement from the industry.

More recently he has been working as a lecturer at Eizou Technical Academy.

Date of Birth: June 19th, 1937
Date of Death: January 16th, 1993

Father of [Akatsuki Yamatoya](https://anilist.co/staff/101308)

__Birthplace:__ Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%A4%A7%E5%B7%9D%E4%BF%8A%E9%81%93)

Toshimichi Ookawa is a screenwriter and film director.

He graduated from the Faculty of Law, Meiji University in 1980. Made his screenwriting debut on Taiyou ni Hoero, a long-running prime-time detective series. In anime he debuted as a screenwriter on [Cat's Eye](https://anilist.co/anime/2043/).
